sen.j: たらこ（鱈子）とは、タラの卵巣（魚卵）。
sen.e: Tarako means the ovary (roe) of cod.
Tarako refers to the ovary (roe) of cod.
sen.cmt: means→refers to,スペースを修正しました。
sen.e: Tarako refers to the ovary (roe) of cod.

sen.j: 広義にはマダラ（真鱈）等の物や生の物も含むが、狭義においては特に真子（スケトウダラ（助党鱈・介党鱈）の卵巣）を塩漬けにしたものを限定して指す。
sen.e: In a broad sense, tarako includes roes of Pacific cod and fresh raw cod roes while in a narrow sense, it means exclusively salted "mako" (ovary of Walleye pollack).
In a broad sense, tarako includes roes of Pacific cod and fresh raw cod roes while in a narrow sense, it means exclusively salted "mako" (ovary of Walleye pollack).
In a broad sense, tarako includes roes of Pacific cod and fresh raw cod roes while in a narrow sense, it means exclusively salted "mako" (ovary of Walleye pollack).

sen.j: 以下、狭義の「真子の塩漬け」を意味するたらこについて記述する。
sen.e: Set forth below is explanation about tarako of a narrow sense which means "salted mako".
Set forth below is the explanation about tarako of the narrow sense which means 'salted mako.'
sen.cmt: the を挿入、a→the,クォーツ、ピリオドの位置を修正しました。
sen.e: Set forth below is the explanation about tarako of the narrow sense which means 'salted mako.'

sen.j: 主な産地は北海道など。
sen.e: The main production areas of tarako include Hokkaido.
The main production areas of tarako include Hokkaido.
The main production areas of tarako include Hokkaido.

sen.j: 同じ真子を使用する加工食品に辛子明太子がある。
sen.e: One example of processed food using mako is karashi-mentaiko (spicy salted cod roe).
One example of processed food using the mako is karashi-mentaiko (spicy salted cod roe).
One example of processed food using the mako is karashi-mentaiko (spicy salted cod roe).

sen.j: 鮮魚市場で特に区別するときには、スケトウダラの子をすけそうの子（助そ子）、マダラの子をマダラの子と呼ぶ。
sen.e: In case of making distinctions of species in fresh fish markets, roes of Walleye pollack are called sukeso-no-ko (or sukeso-ko) and roes of Pacific cod are called madara-no-ko.
In case of making distinctions of species in fresh fish markets, roes of Walleye pollack are called sukeso-no-ko (or sukeso-ko) and roes of Pacific cod are called madara-no-ko.
sen.cmt: スペースの修正をしました。
sen.e: In case of making distinctions of species in fresh fish markets, roes of Walleye pollack are called sukeso-no-ko (or sukeso-ko) and roes of Pacific cod are called madara-no-ko.

sen.j: そのまま食べるほか、加熱して焼きたらことしたりする。
sen.e: Tarako is eaten raw or heated to be eaten as "yaki-tarako" (grilled tarako).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Tarako is eaten raw or heated to be eaten as "yaki-tarako" (grilled tarako).
sen.cmt: スペースの修正をしました。
sen.e: Tarako is eaten raw or heated to be eaten as "yaki-tarako" (grilled tarako).

sen.j: おにぎりの具材や茶漬けの具、あるいはイカと和えて肴としたりもする。
sen.e: Tarako is also also used as an ingredient in rice balls and as a topping on "chaduke" (boiled rice with tea poured over it (a bowl of rice and tea) or used to dress squid meat for an appetizer to go with sake.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Tarako is also used as an ingredient in rice balls and as a topping on "chazuke" (boiled rice with tea poured over it [a bowl of rice and tea]) or dressed with squid meat for an appetizer to go with sake.
sen.cmt: alsoを削除、chaduke→chazuke,カッコを修正しました。used to dress→dressed with と修正しました。
sen.e: Tarako is also used as an ingredient in rice balls and as a topping on "chazuke" (boiled rice with tea poured over it [a bowl of rice and tea]) or dressed with squid meat for an appetizer to go with sake.

sen.j: 日本料理全般にわたり使用されるポピュラーな食材である。
sen.e: Thus, tarako is a popular foodstuff widely used in Japanese cooking.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Thus, tarako is a popular foodstuff widely used in Japanese cooking.
Thus, tarako is a popular foodstuff widely used in Japanese cooking.

sen.j: また、たらこスパゲッティの具ともなり、加熱すると食感が変わる。
sen.e: Also, tarako is used as an ingredient of spaghetti sauce and when heated, texture of tarako changes.
Also, tarako is used as the ingredient of tarako spaghetti (spaghetti with salted cod roe) and when heated, texture of tarako changes.
sen.cmt: ”たらこスパゲッティ: tarako spaghetthi” として修正しました。（ウェブ上にて確認できたため）
sen.e: Also, tarako is used as the ingredient of tarako spaghetti (spaghetti with salted cod roe) and when heated, texture of tarako changes.

sen.j: 塩分が高い。
sen.e: Tarako is salty.
Tarako is salty.
Tarako is salty.

sen.j: ビタミンA、ビタミンB3（ナイアシン）が豊富に含まれる。
sen.e: Tarako is rich in Vitamin A and Vitamin B3 (niacin).
Tarako is rich in Vitamin A and Vitamin B3 (niacin).
Tarako is rich in Vitamin A and Vitamin B3 (niacin).

sen.j: 主な成分は水分約65%、たんぱく質28.5%、脂質1.7%。
sen.e: Tarako consists mainly of about 65% of water, 28.5% of protein and 1.7 % of fats.
Tarako consists mainly of about 65 % of water, 28.5 % of protein and 1.7 % of fats.
sen.cmt: スペースを修正しました。
sen.e: Tarako consists mainly of about 65 % of water, 28.5 % of protein and 1.7 % of fats.

sen.j: ときどき表面に暗緑色のしみがあるものがあるが、これは胆汁である。
sen.e: Dark green stains sometimes found on the surface of tarako are bile.
Dark green stains sometimes found on the surface of tarako are bile.
Dark green stains sometimes found on the surface of tarako are bile.

sen.j: 別称、もみじ子(北信越、北海道地方)。
sen.e: Another name of tarako is momijiko (used in Hokushinetsu regions and Hokkaido)
Another name of tarako is momijiko (used in Hokushinetsu regions and Hokkaido).
sen.cmt: ピリオドを挿入しました。
sen.e: Another name of tarako is momijiko (used in Hokushinetsu regions and Hokkaido).

sen.j: 排他的経済水域設定以後は海域の規制により日本産原料が減った。
sen.e: Since the exclusive economic zone was set, Japan's domestic production of raw material for tarako has decreased due to regulations imposed on the sea zones.
Since the exclusive economic zone has been set, Japan's domestic production of raw material for tarako has decreased due to the regulations imposed on the sea zones.
sen.cmt: was→has been,the を挿入しました。
sen.e: Since the exclusive economic zone has been set, Japan's domestic production of raw material for tarako has decreased due to the regulations imposed on the sea zones.

sen.j: 1993年のベーリング海の自主的操業中止以降はアメリカ合衆国・ロシアより冷凍原料を買い入れる。
sen.e: Since the voluntary suspension of fishing activities in the Bering Sea started in 1993, Japan has been procuring frozen raw materials for tarako from the United States and Russia.
Since the voluntary suspension of fishing activities in the Bering Sea started in 1993, Japan has been importing frozen raw materials for tarako from the United States and Russia.
Since the voluntary suspension of fishing activities in the Bering Sea started in 1993, Japan has been importing frozen raw materials for tarako from the United States and Russia.

sen.j: 現在の日本産の原料はたらこ原料の10%程度に減産。
sen.e: The domestic production of raw material for tarako has decreased to the 10% level of the total amount used to produce tarako in Japan.
The domestic production of raw material for tarako has decreased to the 10 % level of the total amount used to produce tarako in Japan.
sen.cmt: スペースの修正をしました。
sen.e: The domestic production of raw material for tarako has decreased to the 10 % level of the total amount used to produce tarako in Japan.

sen.j: 主に北海道日本海沿岸で延縄漁によって漁獲され、釣り子などの漁で漁獲される「釣り物たらこ」はたいへん希少であり、市場で安定的に出回ることはまずない。
sen.e: "Tsurimono tarako", which is tarako produced from raw material fish caught off the Sea of Japan coast of Hokkaido by haenawa-ryo (fishing by using haenawa) involving tsuriko (a way of fishing) is very rare and not stably supplied in the markets.

Tsurimono tarako,' which is tarako produced from raw material fish, caught off the Sea of Japan coast of Hokkaido by haenawa-ryo (fishing by using haenawa) using tsuriko (a way of fishing), is very rare and not stably supplied in the markets.
sen.cmt: クォーツ、カンマの位置を修正しました。カンマを挿入しました。involving→using と修正しました。
sen.e: Tsurimono tarako,' which is tarako produced from raw material fish, caught off the Sea of Japan coast of Hokkaido by haenawa-ryo (fishing by using haenawa) using tsuriko (a way of fishing), is very rare and not stably supplied in the markets.

sen.j: 辛子明太子とたらこの販売比率は73程度で、たらこを唐辛子漬けに加工した辛子明太子の市場が多いとされる。
sen.e: The sales ratio of karashi-mentaiko to tarako being around 73, it is said that karashi-mentaiko produced by marinating tarako in hot pepper sauce is larger than that of tarako.
The sales ratio of karashi-mentaiko to tarako is about 7:3, it is said that the market of karashi-mentaiko produced by marinating tarako in hot pepper sauce is larger than that of tarako.
sen.cmt: being around 73→is about 7:3 と修正し、the market of を挿入しました。
sen.e: The sales ratio of karashi-mentaiko to tarako is about 7:3, it is said that the market of karashi-mentaiko produced by marinating tarako in hot pepper sauce is larger than that of tarako.

sen.j: 虎杖浜
sen.e: Kojohama
Kojohama
Kojohama

sen.j: - 日本屈指のたらこ加工地。
sen.e: -One of Japan's leading production areas of tarako
-One of Japan's leading production areas of tarako.
sen.cmt: ピリオドを挿入しました。
sen.e: -One of Japan's leading production areas of tarako.

sen.j: テレビなどの通販番組でも、「虎杖浜産のたらこ」として扱うなどブランド化。
sen.e: Tarako produced in Kojohama is a brand product called "kojohama-no-tarako" (salted cod roe made in Kojohama), often sold in home-shopping TV programs.
Tarako produced in Kojohama has become a brand product called 'kojohama-no-tarako' (salted cod roe made in Kojohama), which has been sold in television home shopping programs.
sen.cmt: is→has become と修正し、クォーツ、スペースを修正しました。後半部分を文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: Tarako produced in Kojohama has become a brand product called 'kojohama-no-tarako' (salted cod roe made in Kojohama), which has been sold in television home shopping programs.

sen.j: 北海道日本海沿岸
sen.e: The Sea of Japan coastline of Hokkaido
The Sea of Japan coastline of Hokkaido
The Sea of Japan coastline of Hokkaido

sen.j: - スケソウダラの一本釣りにより傷みが少ない良質な「釣りたらこ」。
sen.e: -"Tsuritarako"produced in this region has high quality because each Walleye pollack is caught by Ippon-zuri (a way of fishing where a fishing line and a hook is used) in which the fish body is less damaged than fish caught by other methods.

-'Tsuritarako' produced in this region has high quality because each Walleye pollack is caught by Ippon-zuri (a way of fishing where a fishing line and a hook is used) in which the fish body is less damaged than fish caught by other methods.
sen.cmt: クォーツ、スペースを修正しました。
sen.e: -'Tsuritarako' produced in this region has high quality because each Walleye pollack is caught by Ippon-zuri (a way of fishing where a fishing line and a hook is used) in which the fish body is less damaged than fish caught by other methods.

sen.j: 少量生産のため価格は高め。
sen.e: Since the production amount of tsuritarako is small, the price is relatively high.
The price is relatively high due to its small production.
sen.cmt: 文をよりスムースに修正しました。
sen.e: The price is relatively high due to its small production.

sen.j: 明治36年頃、北海道で不振であったマダラにかわってスケトウダラの漁が発展したことから卵の加工が始まり、その影響でたらこが普及するようになったと言われている。
sen.e: Because catches of Pacific cod were poor around 1903 in Hokkaido, fishing for Walleye pollack replaced Pacific cod fishing and it since developed, which led to processing of cod roes and in turn, to the widespread consumption of tarako.

It is said that, the development of Walleye pollack fishing which replaced the Pacific cod fishing that stagnated around 1903 in Hokkaido, led the production of cod roes to begin, and by that, the tarako has become widespread.
sen.cmt: 文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: It is said that, the development of Walleye pollack fishing which replaced the Pacific cod fishing that stagnated around 1903 in Hokkaido, led the production of cod roes to begin, and by that, the tarako has become widespread.

sen.j: その後は日本全土に広まり、現在日本では北海道白老町の虎杖浜が一番有名な産地となっている。
sen.e: Thereafter, tarako has spread all overJapan, and today Kojohama of Shiraoi-cho, Hokkaido has become the most famous production area of tarako in Japan.
Thereafter, tarako has spread all over Japan, and today Kojohama of Shiraoi-cho, Hokkaido has become the most famous production area of tarako in Japan.
sen.cmt: スペースを修正しました。
sen.e: Thereafter, tarako has spread all over Japan, and today Kojohama of Shiraoi-cho, Hokkaido has become the most famous production area of tarako in Japan.

sen.j: 2006年にはたらこを使用した加工食品のCMソングとして「たらこ・たらこ・たらこ」がリリースされた。
sen.e: In 2006, "Tarako, tarako, tarako" was released as a song used in a commercial for a processed food product using tarako.
In 2006, 'Tarako, tarako, tarako' was released as a commercial song for a processed food using tarako.
sen.cmt: クォーツを修正しました。song used in a commercial→commercial song,product を削除しました。
sen.e: In 2006, 'Tarako, tarako, tarako' was released as a commercial song for a processed food using tarako.

sen.j: 「明太子」という言葉は、現在、全国的に見れば「辛子明太子」の事を指す言葉として使われる場合が多いが、「辛子明太子」の本場福岡県をはじめとした西日本の一部地域ではトウガラシを使わない、本稿で説明している「たらこ」を示す言葉として、辛子明太子とは明確に使い分けられるため注意が必要である。
sen.e: Today the word "mentaiko" is used to mean "karashi-mentaiko"in most parts of Japan, but the word is tricky to use in that in some parts of western Japan such as Fukuoka Prefecture, the home of karashi-mentaiko, the word is used to mean "tarako" without being marinated with hot pepper sauce, which is explained above in this article, and the word is clearly distinguished from the word "karashi-mentaiko".

Today the word 'mentaiko' is used to mean 'karashi-mentaiko' in most parts of Japan, but the word is tricky to use in that in some parts of western Japan such as Fukuoka Prefecture, the home of karashi-mentaiko, the word is used to mean 'tarako' without being marinated with hot pepper sauce, which is explained above in this article, and we need to pay attention since the word is clearly distinguished from the word 'karashi-mentaiko.'
sen.cmt: クォーツを修正しました。ピリオドの位置を修正しました。スペースの修正をしました。”注意が必要である”を補いました。
sen.e: Today the word 'mentaiko' is used to mean 'karashi-mentaiko' in most parts of Japan, but the word is tricky to use in that in some parts of western Japan such as Fukuoka Prefecture, the home of karashi-mentaiko, the word is used to mean 'tarako' without being marinated with hot pepper sauce, which is explained above in this article, and we need to pay attention since the word is clearly distinguished from the word 'karashi-mentaiko.'

sen.j: 「明太子」とはそもそもたらこを示す言葉である。
sen.e: Originally, the word "mentaiko"(明太子) means cod roe,
Originally, the word 'mentaiko' (明太子) means cod roe.
sen.cmt: クォーツ、ピリオド、スペースを修正しました。
sen.e: Originally, the word 'mentaiko' (明太子) means cod roe.

sen.j: 本来、「スケトウダラ」を示す朝鮮語「ミョンテ」（明太）、またはロシア語「ミンダイ」の子という意味の言葉である。
sen.e: The original meaning comes from combination of "myonte"(明太), a Korean word, or "mindai", a Russian word, both meaning Walleye pollack with the last character "子"(roe).
The original meaning comes from the combination of 'myonte'(明太), a Korean word, or 'mindai,' a Russian word, both meaning Walleye pollack with the last character "子"(roe).
sen.cmt: the を挿入、クォーツ、カンマの位置を修正しました。
sen.e: The original meaning comes from the combination of 'myonte'(明太), a Korean word, or 'mindai,' a Russian word, both meaning Walleye pollack with the last character "子"(roe).

sen.j: 元々たらこを示す言葉としての「明太子」が使われない地域において、お土産としてメジャーになった「辛子明太子」がもたらされるうちに、その「辛子明太子」の略称として「明太子」という言葉が全国的に広がっていった物と考えられる。
sen.e: Assumedly, as karashi-mentaiko became a popular souvenir and more and more karashi mentaiko was brought to places where the word "mentaiko"meaning tarako was not known, the word "mentaiko" came to be used and spread as an abbreviation for "karashi-mentaiko".

Assumedly, as karashi-mentaiko became a popular souvenir and more and more karashi-mentaiko was brought to places where the word 'mentaiko' means tarako was not known, the word 'mentaiko' came to be used and spread as an abbreviation of 'karashi-mentaiko.'
sen.cmt: karashi mentaiko→karashi-mentaiko.meaning→means,for→of,クォーツ、スペース、ピリオドの位置を修正しました。
sen.e: Assumedly, as karashi-mentaiko became a popular souvenir and more and more karashi-mentaiko was brought to places where the word 'mentaiko' means tarako was not known, the word 'mentaiko' came to be used and spread as an abbreviation of 'karashi-mentaiko.'

tit.cmt: 大文字に修正しました。

sen.j: キユーピーのコマーシャルメッセージキャラクター「たらこキユーピー」やクラックスのキャラクター「たらこ大作戦」は、たらこをモチーフとしている。
sen.e: Tarako is featured in a mascot character named "Tarako Kewpie"used in commercials for a product of Kewpie Corporation and also tarako is used as a motif in "Tarako Dai-sakusen" (The Blitz of Salted Cod Roe), a character of Crux (stationery company).

Tarako is featured in a mascot character named 'Tarako Kewpie' used in commercials for a product of Kewpie Corporation, and also used as a motif in 'Tarako Dai-sakusen' (The Blitz of Salted Cod Roe), a character of Crux (stationery company).
sen.cmt: クォーツ、スペースを修正しました。カンマを挿入し、tarako is を削除しました。
sen.e: Tarako is featured in a mascot character named 'Tarako Kewpie' used in commercials for a product of Kewpie Corporation, and also used as a motif in 'Tarako Dai-sakusen' (The Blitz of Salted Cod Roe), a character of Crux (stationery company).

tit.j: たらこから名づけられたもの

sen.j: 厚い唇や厚い唇をした人の事を、その形状の類似からたらこくちびると揶揄する事がある。
sen.e: Thick lips or people having thick lips are sometimes mockingly called "tarako-kuchibiru", because tarako looks like thick lips.
Thick lips or people having thick lips are sometimes mockingly called "tarako-kuchibiru," because tarako look like thick lips.

sen.e: Thick lips or people having thick lips are sometimes mockingly called "tarako-kuchibiru," because tarako look like thick lips.

sen.j: 旧日本国有鉄道末期の気動車の塗装（朱色5号一色）の蔑称で使われることがある。
sen.e: Tarako is sometimes used for a derogatory term for the color (vermillion No.5) of coating of diesel trains which formerJapanese National Railway used in its late period.
Tarako is sometimes used for a derogatory term for the color (vermillion No. 5) of coating of diesel trains which former Japanese National Railway used in its late period.
sen.cmt: スペースの修正をしました。（色の名称であるので、5はそのままにしました）
sen.e: Tarako is sometimes used for a derogatory term for the color (vermillion No. 5) of coating of diesel trains which former Japanese National Railway used in its late period.
